qas.question: In which War was Detroit captured by the British?
In which battle did American troops suffer the highest casualties?
In which year was Detroit recaptured?
In which county is the park commemorating the Battle of Frenchtown?

context: From 1805 to 1847, Detroit was the capital of Michigan (first the territory, then the state). Detroit surrendered without a fight to British troops during the <a0_0>War of 1812<a0_0/> in the Siege of Detroit. The <a1_0>Battle of Frenchtown<a1_0/> (January 18–23, <a2_0>1813<a2_0/>) was part of a United States effort to retake the city, and American troops suffered their highest fatalities of any battle in the war. This battle is commemorated at River Raisin National Battlefield Park south of Detroit in <a3_0>Monroe County<a3_0/>. Detroit was finally recaptured by the United States later that year.
